remarks: Disjunctive distinct variable constraint elimination.  A user of this theorem starts with a formula ` ph ` (containing ` z ` ) and a distinct variable constraint between ` x ` and ` z ` .  The theorem makes it possible to replace the distinct variable constraint with the disjunct ` A. x x = y ` ( ` ps ` is just a version of ` ph ` with ` y ` substituted for ` z ` ).  (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 11-May-2018.)
statement:
dvelimor.1 $e |- F/ x ph $.
dvelimor.2 $e |- ( z = y -> ( ph <-> ps ) ) $.
dvelimor $p |- ( A. x x = y \/ F/ x ps ) $.
$d ps z $.
$d x z $.
